Lamput. Write a forum convo where a user says their kid is asking where Kikoriki is, even though Squish, Horrid Henry, BFDI, Fast Forward and The Owl are his new favourite

**Thread Title: Where's Kikoriki? Plus, My Kid's New Favorites on CartoonLand**

**Post by: CartoonFanatic101**

Hey fellow CartoonLand viewers! My little one has recently become fixated on asking about where Kikoriki has gone. It used to be one of his staples, right beside the adventures of Pogoroo and Chiko. But, I must say, his tastes are evolving with the channel's current programming, and it's been quite the transition!

He's now utterly captivated by the quirky charm of Squish and cannot get enough of the misadventures of Horrid Henry—probably sees a bit of himself in the master of mischief, if I'm being honest. Battle for Dream Island (BFDI) has become a surprising hit in our household, with its unique characters and engaging battles; it's a topic of dinner table discussions nowadays. He's also taken a liking to TMNT Fast Forward, though I sense it's the futuristic setting that grabs his attention more than anything.

And let's not forget The Owl; its humor seems to tickle him just right, making it a much-waited-for part of his weekday TV lineup.

**While** we have these new favorites, he still occasionally asks, "Why did Kikoriki disappear?" Anyone else's kids missing Kikoriki from the lineup? I've tried explaining that shows come and go to make room for new ones, but you know how it is with their favorites.

**How do you folks handle these transitions with your kids? And have your little ones found new favorites among the current lineup like mine has? Would love to hear your stories and maybe get some tips on easing the "loss" of a beloved show!**

---

**Reply by: ToonParent123**

Oh, we've been through our share of "Missing Show Syndrome" in our household, CartoonFanatic101! My tactic has been to introduce similar shows from the current programming to fill that void. Seems like you're already on that track with Squish, Horrid Henry, and others.

Kikoriki was a hit in our house too, and it took some time for the kids to stop asking for it. We got into Robotboy and Monster Allergy for a bit of that adventure and friendship vibe they loved so much in Kikoriki. Perhaps you could lean into some shows that have similar themes or humor?

---

**Reply by: NewToonsFan**

This is all too relatable! My strategy has been to hype up the new additions as "special premieres" or "exclusive shows" to create excitement. It helped transition from mourning the loss of one show to the eager anticipation of another. For Kikoriki, maybe you can find it streaming somewhere or get DVDs? That way, it's not really "gone," just moved to a special place for whenever the new favorites don't cut it.

---

**Reply by: AnimationStation**

Totally understand this! I think what works for us is mixing things up with online content related to their missed favorites while warmly embracing the new shows. Also, engaging them in conversations about what exactly they loved about Kikoriki can help identify new shows with similar themes or characters. Sometimes it's the camaraderie, other times it's the humor, and finding that in new shows might soften the blow. And, occasionally letting them watch old episodes online helps too!

**Would anyone be interested in a CartoonLand viewing party? Maybe we can watch some of the current favorites? Could be a neat way to share the fun and introduce our kids to some group viewing dynamics. Thoughts?**
Write a follow up asking why some shows only air 1 season,

**Thread Title: Curious About "One-Season Wonders" on CartoonLand?**

**Post by: CartoonFanatic101**

Hello again, dear CartoonLand community!

Following up on our previous discussion about favorite shows and the disappearance of beloved series like Kikoriki, there's something else that’s been on my mind and perhaps yours too. I've noticed that some shows on CartoonLand, much like with Johnny Test (where we only get Season 1), only grace our screens for a single season. This got me thinking and, frankly, a bit curious about the reasons behind these "one-season wonders."

For instance, Johnny Test Season 1 brings so much joy and laughter into our home, and just as we're fully invested, we're left hanging, craving more of the Test family's escapades. This pattern seems to replicate with a few other series on the channel as well.

So, my question to you all, and perhaps even to the CartoonLand planners lurking among us: **Why do some shows only air one season?** Is it a licensing thing, audience reception, or perhaps part of keeping the content fresh and diverse? 

Also, **how do you folks navigate this with your kids?** Do you look for other seasons elsewhere, do you recap the one season as a completed story, or do you seamlessly shift their attention to another show on CartoonLand's rich roster?

And finally, **is there a way for us, as a community, to show support for certain shows** that we’d love to see more of? Maybe our collective voice could bring back or extend the life of some "one-season wonders" on CartoonLand.

Looking forward to your insights, stories, and advice on navigating this with our young and impressionable viewers!

---

**Reply by: ToonParent123**

Great points, CartoonFanatic101! It does feel like a tease sometimes, getting so invested in a show, only to have it end abruptly. I've always assumed it was due to licensing issues or perhaps the shows not performing as expected. We usually try to find the rest of the series on streaming platforms if possible, to give our kids some closure.

---

**Reply by: NewToonsFan**

I've been there too! It's tough explaining to a little one why their new favorite show isn't coming back for more adventures. I'd love to know if there's a possibility of campaigns or petitions we could start to show our interest in more seasons. Sometimes it feels like decisions are made without considering how much these shows mean to our families.

---

**Reply by: AnimationStation**

This is a recurring puzzle in our household as well. It often leads us on a hunt for similar shows to fill the gap. However, understanding the intricacies behind these decisions would certainly help in explaining things to our young viewers. Also, knowing there's a way to possibly influence more content would be empowering for us as a viewer base!

Write a forum convo asking if Kikoriki is returning and if TMNT will move past FF

**Thread Title: Any Chance of Kikoriki's Return and TMNT Moving Beyond Fast Forward?**

**Post by: ToonNostalgiaParent**

Hey CartoonLand community,

I've been on this nostalgic journey recently, rewatching some of the classics with my kids, and it got me reminiscing about Kikoriki. It was such a unique show that offered both humor and lessons for the little ones. And with TMNT, the Fast Forward season brought a fresh twist to the series we all grew fondly of. My kids have been hooked, to say the least!

I've been out of the loop for a while, so I'm wondering if there's been any whisper or hint about Kikoriki possibly making a return to CartoonLand? It seemed like such a staple that disappeared too soon. Also, has there been any talk about TMNT continuing past the Fast Forward season here? Would love to catch more of the TMNT universe if it's in the works.

Would appreciate any info you guys have or speculative thoughts on whether these might see the light of day once more on our screens. It'd make for some happy viewing in our household!

**Reply by: ClassicToonFan**

@ToonNostalgiaParent, ahh, Kikoriki and TMNT FF hold special places in my heart too! As far as I know, there's been no official word on Kikoriki’s return yet, which is a bummer. It was truly one-of-a-kind. Regarding TMNT moving past Fast Forward, I haven’t heard anything concrete, but with the way nostalgia’s been a key player in show revivals lately, I wouldn't lose hope!

**Reply by: ModernToonsAdvocate**

I feel you, @ToonNostalgiaParent! Kikoriki had such a charm to it that's hard to find in recent shows. And TMNT never gets old, no matter the season. There’s been a lot of fan chatter online about wanting more TMNT, specifically beyond Fast Forward, but no official announcements yet. Fingers crossed that CartoonLand listens to the fans!

**Reply by: AnimationInsider**

Hey all! While I don’t have insider info on Kikoriki, there’s always a possibility for returns with enough fan interest. These decisions often come down to licensing and demand. As for TMNT, the series has a robust fanbase, and there’s always potential for more content if the demand is shown. Keep the conversation going online. Networks do pay attention to these discussions!

**Reply by: ToonNostalgiaParent**

Thanks for the insights, everyone! It's comforting to know there's still love and hope for these shows' return or continuation. Guess it's time to rally the fanbases and show CartoonLand there's still a demand. Let’s keep our fingers crossed and maybe start some social media campaigns to bring more attention to our favorite toons! 🤞📺 #BringBackKikoriki #MoreTMNT
Write a follow up where a kid loves Chaotic, and also soon some furry friends are returning, replacing the Prank Patrol

**Thread Title: From Chaotic to Furry Friends: Updates on CartoonLand Programming!**

**Post by: FamilyViewingFun**

Hello again, beloved CartoonLand community!

I wanted to share some joyful news and also a bit of an update from our household viewing habits. My kid’s latest obsession has been Chaotic—and I must admit, I've found myself getting quite engrossed in the episodes too. The complexity, the action, and those wild strategies have sparked some fun, imaginative playtimes and discussions at home. It’s been a fantastic journey watching my kid get so passionate about a show, analyzing the characters' moves and plotting their own strategies.

**But** there's more exciting news on the horizon for CartoonLand viewers! It appears some **furry friends** are making their way back to the lineup, stepping in to replace Prank Patrol. While we’ve had quite a few laughs with Prank Patrol, the anticipation of what these "furry friends" could be is building up. The hints so far suggest a return of some beloved animal characters that many of us have fondly missed!

So, what are your guesses? Which furry friends do you think are making a comeback? And how have your kids (or perhaps you!) adapted to the changing show roster on CartoonLand?

Would love to hear how other shows like Chaotic have caught the imagination of your little ones and how you’re feeling about this upcoming transition from Prank Patrol to our mystery furry friends. Let's embrace the wave of nostalgia and the new memories we're about to make with these returning characters!

**Reply by AnimatedAdventures**

We're huge Chaotic fans here too, @FamilyViewingFun! It's amazing how shows like these can spark so much creativity and strategic thinking in kids. As for the furry friends returning, my bets are on something classic—maybe a throwback that’s been absent for too long. So curious to see who it is!

**Reply by ToonLoverParent**

The excitement is real! Prank Patrol has had a good run, but there's something special about those shows with animal characters that teach compassion, friendship, and sometimes, a bit of mischief. Can't wait to introduce my kids to these returning faces; I’m hopeful it’s a classic that I grew up with!

**Reply by: NextGenWatcher**

@FamilyViewingFun, thanks for sharing that! My kids have transitioned from show to show pretty smoothly, and Chaotic helped develop their problem-solving skills in such a fun way. Eager to find out which furry friends are returning. If they’re aiming to replace Prank Patrol, it has to be something engaging and heartfelt. Fingers crossed it's a hit from our childhood making a grand return!

**Reply by: CartoonConnoisseur**

This is exciting news indeed! Chaotic has been a breath of fresh air with its deep strategic gameplay and storylines. As for the return of our furry friends, I'm intrigued. CartoonLand has been doing a fantastic job of blending nostalgic content with new favorites. Here's hoping the returnees will inspire and entertain a new generation just as much as they did for us!
Write a follow up where Kikoriki is returning, and a user suggests pairing it with TO/TO&C and YH&F, also will Lamput return

**Thread Title: Kikoriki's Grand Return to CartoonLand! Pairing Suggestions & Lamput’s Fate?**

**Post by: RetroToonLover**

Hello CartoonLand Enthusiasts!

I've got some thrilling news to share with all of you—Kikoriki is officially making its much-anticipated return to CartoonLand! This calls for a celebration for fans old and new. The adventures of Krash, Chiko, Rosa, and the gang have been sorely missed, and it's fantastic to hear they'll be gracing our screens once more.

In light of this exciting development, I've been pondering about show pairings that would complement the whimsical world of Kikoriki. Given the channel's current lineup, pairing it with The Owl & The Owl & Co (TO/TO&C) and YooHoo and Friends (YH&F) could create a delightful block of fun, adventure, and learning for our kids. Both sets of shows carry a light-hearted tone coupled with important lessons, making them perfect companions to Kikoriki's unique blend of humor and morals.

On another note, amidst this joyous return, a question lingers in the back of my mind—what about Lamput? The show garnered quite the following with its hilarious cat-and-mouse game, or should I say, doctor-and-Lamput chase. Any news or hints if our favorite orange blob will make a comeback as well?

Would love to hear your thoughts on the Kikoriki pairing and any info or speculation about Lamput's return. Let's dive into discussions and share our excitement for what's shaping up to be an incredible season on CartoonLand!

**Reply by: CartoonConvergence**

RetroToonLover, you just made my day with the Kikoriki news! Pairing it with TO/TO&C and YH&F sounds like a recipe for success. It'd create an unbeatable lineup that's both entertaining and enlightening. As for Lamput, I haven't heard anything concrete yet, but I'm keeping my fingers crossed. Its unique humor is unmatched, and it'd be the perfect cherry on top of an already stellar lineup!

**Reply by: NostalgiaNerd**

Absolutely thrilled about Kikoriki's return and love the pairing suggestion! Those shows together would cover such a wide array of themes and humor, perfect for a family-friendly block. Regarding Lamput, last I checked there were murmurs of a possible return, but nothing confirmed. Let's hope CartoonLand brings back our squishy friend. It's a show that truly stands out for its creativity and comedy.

**Reply by: KiddieCartoonKing**

Kikoriki coming back is the best news I've heard all week, and pairing it with TO/TO&C and YH&F? Genius! Those thematic similarities will definitely attract a cohesive audience. And oh, how I miss Lamput! It has to return. Its wacky humor and the endless possibilities for episodes make it a gem. CartoonLand, if you're listening, bring back Lamput too!

**Reply by: FamilyFunTimeWatcher**

Joining in on the excitement for Kikoriki and totally on board with those pairings—they'd cater to a delightful mix of tastes and interests. As for Lamput, my entire family is holding out hope. Its absence has been noticeable, and its return would complete the perfect CartoonLand lineup. Let's keep our fingers crossed and maybe start a hashtag campaign? #BringBackLamput anyone?
Write a Saturday morning lineup from 7am to 12pm (Squish has left the SatAM lineup, replaced with more FF)

**CartoonLand's Exciting Saturday Morning Lineup!**

Dive into an adventure-packed Saturday with CartoonLand! We've refreshed our lineup to bring more excitement, laughter, and thrills into your weekend mornings. While we bid a fond farewell to Squish in our Saturday AM lineup, we're thrilled to announce that we're dialing up the action with more Fast Forward (FF) episodes! Get ready for a fantastic mix of heroics, hijinks, and heart.

**7:00 AM - Kikoriki**  
Kick off your early morning with the whimsical world of Kikoriki! Join Krash, Chiko, Rosa, and the entire gang as they embark on hilarious adventures, learning valuable lessons about friendship, creativity, and problem-solving along the way.

**7:30 AM - The Owl & Co**  
Continue the laughter with The Owl & Co! Watch as The Owl hilariously fails at trying to catch his one true desire - a tasty meal, leading to a series of slapstick, laugh-out-loud misadventures.

**8:00 AM - TMNT: Fast Forward**  
Gear up for more action with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward! Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello, and Raphael jump to the future, facing new enemies and exciting challenges while finding a way back to their own time.

**8:30 AM - TMNT: Fast Forward**  
More TMNT action awaits! Stay tuned for back-to-back episodes as the turtles navigate the futuristic city of New New York, combining brains, brawn, and pizza to battle evil wherever it lurks.

**9:00 AM - Horrid Henry**  
Switch gears with Horrid Henry's mischievous escapades! Whether he's plotting his next big scheme or dealing with his goody-two-shoes brother, Perfect Peter, you're in for a wildly entertaining time.

**9:30 AM - Code Lyoko**  
Dive into the digital world with Code Lyoko. Follow Yumi, Ulrich, Odd, and Jeremy as they balance their school life with running off to the virtual world of Lyoko to thwart the malevolent AI, X.A.N.A.'s latest plans.

**10:00 AM - Xiaolin Showdown**  
Join the quest for the Shen Gong Wu in Xiaolin Showdown! Omi, Kimiko, Raimundo, and Clay face off against the forces of evil, engaging in epic showdowns to protect the world from dark forces.

**10:30 AM - The Hollow**  
Embark on a mysterious adventure with The Hollow. Three teenagers wake up in a mysterious realm with no memory of who they are or how they got there. Together, they must solve challenging puzzles and face fearsome foes to find their way home.

**11:00 AM - Johnny Test (Season 1)**  
Unleash the experiments with Johnny Test! Follow the fearless Johnny, his genetically modified talking dog, Dukey, and his brainy twin sisters, Susan and Mary, through outrageous adventures and gnarly science experiments.

**11:30 AM - Monster Allergy**  
Close out your morning with Monster Allergy! Join Zick, a young boy with the ability to see the invisible monsters that live among us, as he navigates the challenges of monsters, school, and friends, with a healthy dose of humor.

Enjoy your Saturday mornings with CartoonLand, where there’s something fun for everyone! Tune in and start your weekends off right with our can’t-miss lineup.

Lamput. Write a forum convo about the 6 most popular shows rh

**User1: ClassicToonFan91**

Hey everyone! I've been following CartoonLand's lineup closely and thought it’d be fun to discuss which shows have really become the channel’s standouts. IMHO, the top six most popular shows on CartoonLand have got to be "Battle for Dream Island", "Inanimate Insanity", "The Owl & Co", "Horrid Henry", "Code Lyoko", and "TMNT (2003, Fast Forward only)". What are your thoughts? Do you guys agree, or do you have different picks for the top spots?

**User2: AnimationNerdXOXO**

Absolutely with you on "Battle for Dream Island" and "Inanimate Insanity"; they’ve definitely captured the audience’s imagination! But I would swap out "The Owl & Co" for "Johnny Test (Season 1 only)". There’s something about that first season that really resonates with the audience, making it a bit of a cult classic.

**User3: ToonMaster98**

I have to give a shout out to "Code Lyoko". It's amazing how well that show has held up over the years, and it has a rather dedicated following in the forums. The blend of animation and CG, not to mention the unique storyline, really sets it apart. And "TMNT (Fast Forward)" – it's nostalgic yet offers something fresh to the new viewers. Those two definitely deserve their spots.

Write an informational ad, saying goodbye, but promoting S, BFDI and FF

🌟 **End of an Era, But Our Adventure Continues! 🌠**

Dear CartoonLand Fans,

As the sun sets on some of our beloved classics, we find ourselves reflecting on the joy, laughter, and countless memories they've given us. One such gem that has illuminated our screens with endless fun and life lessons is **"Kikoriki"**. We understand how deeply this show has touched your hearts, becoming more than just a cartoon but a cherished friend to many.

However, as we bid a heartfelt farewell to "Kikoriki", we're excited to turn the page and embark on new adventures with shows that are ready to spark your imagination and fill your lives with laughter and thrills! 🚀

🔵 **"Squish"** – Dive into the microscopic world of "Squish" and his single-celled friends, living in the bustling metropolis of Small Pond. It’s a microcosm of fun, friendship, and wild adventures that prove even the smallest among us can make a big splash!

⭐ **"Battle for Dream Island" (BFDI)** – Ever imagined a world where inanimate objects come to life and compete for the ultimate prize? "Battle for Dream Island" brings exactly that! With quirky challenges, hilarious moments, and unexpected twists, BFDI promises an engaging experience that will have you rooting for your favorite characters till the very end.

🌀 **"TMNT (Fast Forward)"** – Leap into the future with "TMNT (Fast Forward)" as our beloved teenage mutant ninja turtles embark on futuristic adventures filled with high-tech villains, incredible gadgets, and, as always, the importance of family and honor. It's TMNT like you've never seen them before – faster, more daring, and ready for action!

While we say goodbye to a dear friend, let's open our arms to the new stories awaiting our discovery. The spirit of adventure continues to thrive in CartoonLand, and we're excited for you to join us on these new journeys.

Remember, every end marks a new beginning. Let's cherish the memories and make room for new ones. Here's to the adventures that await, both familiar and unforeseen. 🌈✨

Thank you for being a part of our CartoonLand family. The adventure never ends—it just gets more exciting!

Warmly,

**The CartoonLand Team** 🎈

---

Stay tuned, and don't forget to visit our website and follow us on social media for the latest updates, schedules, and surprises! 🌟

Write a blog post saying "We've noticed you are very sad about Kikoriki being gone", while saying it's returning in the new year, WITH Pincode

**Title: A Special Announcement for Kikoriki Fans: The Return and a New Adventure Await in the New Year!**

Dear CartoonLand devotees,

As the vibrant heart of our animated community, your voices echo loudly in the halls of CartoonLand. Lately, a certain melody of melancholy has resonated with us, a tune tinged with nostalgia and longing for a world filled with round, colorful characters that have captured more hearts than we could have ever imagined. Yes, you’ve guessed it—many of you have expressed a profound sadness over the absence of "Kikoriki" from our lineup.

We've watched, we've listened, and most importantly, we've felt the depth of your connection to this beloved series. It's heartwarming to see how passionately you recall the adventures, laughter, and lessons learned with Krash, Chiko, Wally, and the entire Kikoriki crew. This outpouring of affection has not gone unnoticed.

Therefore, it is with immense joy and excitement that we bring you an announcement straight from the heart of CartoonLand: **"Kikoriki" is making its grand return in the new year!** But wait, there's more. It's not just the Kikoriki gang that's bouncing back into action; they're bringing along some friends for an all-new adventure with the addition of **"Pincode"** to our programming slate.

"Pincode", for those who might be new to its wonders, offers a unique blend of humor and learning, embarking on scientific adventures that promise to spark curiosity and offer fun facts in the delightful and engaging way that only animation can. Pairing "Kikoriki" with "Pincode" means not only rejuvenating beloved memories but also creating new ones, filled with laughter, learning, and that unmistakable warmth that comes from our favorite animated tales.

We understand that saying goodbye, even temporarily, to such cherished characters can feel like bidding farewell to dear friends. But as the new year dawns, we're thrilled to not only welcome these friends back into our lives but also to introduce new ones that will surely find a place in your hearts.

Get ready for a year filled with excitement, education, and entertainment as "Kikoriki" and "Pincode" join forces to bring joy and laughter to CartoonLand once again. This return and new journey signify our commitment to listening to our community and delivering the content you love and long for.

Stay tuned for more details on the return of "Kikoriki" and the premiere of "Pincode". Prepare to embark on new adventures, create lasting memories, and perhaps learn a thing or two along the way. Because in CartoonLand, the fun never stops, the learning never ends, and the welcome back parties are as grand as the adventures that await.

With heartfelt thanks for your passion and patience,

**The CartoonLand Team**

---

Remember, dreams do come true in the magical world of animation. Here's to a new year filled with old friends, new adventures, and the boundless joy of togetherness in CartoonLand.
Write a blog post with 6 great shows to hold your child over till then

**Title: Six Sensational Shows to Savor as We Await the Grand Return of Kikoriki and the Arrival of Pincode**

Dear CartoonLand Family,

As anticipation builds for the celebrated return of "Kikoriki" and the much-awaited introduction of "Pincode" to our beloved network, we recognize the bittersweet pang of waiting. Fear not! The world of CartoonLand is brimming with boundless adventures, laughter, and learning. To ensure that this period of anticipation is filled with as much joy and excitement as the upcoming shows promise, we've curated a list of six sensational shows to captivate and entertain your little ones (and, let's be honest, the not-so-little ones too). 

1. **The Owl & Co**
Dive headfirst into the whimsical world of "The Owl & Co," where humor flutters around every corner. This delightful series encapsulates the essence of friendship and fun, all through the lens of our feathered friends' nightly escapades. It's a hoot for the whole family!

2. **Battle for Dream Island**
An animation sensation that's as engaging as it is innovative, "Battle for Dream Island" offers a unique twist on competition-based storytelling. Watch inanimate objects come to life, each with their own personalities and dreams, as they compete for the ultimate prize. It’s a blend of humor, action, and unexpected twists that will keep everyone on the edge of their seats.

3. **Squish**
Embrace the microscopic world of "Squish" and his ameba friends in their quest to navigate the perils and pleasures of single-celled existence. This show combines scientific curiosity with relatable stories of friendship, making learning about the micro-world an incredibly fun journey.

4. **Robotboy**
For the tech-savvy and superhero fans, "Robotboy" offers high-octane adventures that fuse heart with science fiction. Follow Robotboy as he learns about human emotions, friendship, and the true meaning of being a hero, all while battling villains with his incredible powers.

5. **Horrid Henry**
Dive into the mischievous exploits of "Horrid Henry" and his cast of quirky characters. With a knack for finding trouble, Henry navigates the trials and tribulations of childhood with a blend of humor and chaos that's guaranteed to elicit more than a few giggles from viewers of all ages.

6. **Code Lyoko**
Join a group of students on a quest to save both the real world and a virtual universe from a malevolent force. "Code Lyoko" combines action, mystery, and a dash of science fiction, presenting a captivating narrative that celebrates teamwork, resilience, and the battle between good and evil.

As we count down the days until "Kikoriki" and "Pincode" grace our screens and hearts, let these six fantastic series keep you company. Each show, in its own unique way, represents the diversity, creativity, and joy that define CartoonLand. So, gather the family, grab some popcorn, and embark on these wonderful adventures that await right at your fingertips.

Stay tuned, for before you know it, our beloved "Kikoriki" and the new adventures of "Pincode" will be here to add even more laughter, learning, and love to our CartoonLand family. Until then, happy watching!

With vibrant wishes,

**The CartoonLand Team**

---

*Remember, the best adventures are those shared together. Keep exploring, laughing, and learning with CartoonLand, where imagination knows no bounds.*

Write a follow up where it will replace FF, meaning it's truly gone, also Four Eyes!, a cartoon about an alien girl named Emma who flunked 5th grade on her planet is coming, taking the spare Fast Forward slots not taken by either Kikoriki show

**Title: Embracing Change: "Fast Forward" Says Goodbye as "Kikoriki" and "Four Eyes!" Step into the Spotlight**

Dear CartoonLand Community,

In the ever-evolving landscape of entertainment, change is both inevitable and often, a doorway to new adventures and discoveries. With the thrill of anticipation in the air for the return of "Kikoriki" and the debut of "Four Eyes!", it's a bittersweet moment as we announce a significant shift in our programming schedule that sees us parting ways with "TMNT (2003, Fast Forward)".

"Fast Forward" has been a beacon of action-packed storytelling, captivating imaginations with futuristic tales of our favorite ninja turtles. However, as we bid farewell to this beloved storyline, it's important to remember the joy and thrills it brought into our lives and the lessons of courage, friendship, and determination that will continue to inspire us.

But worry not, for the spirit of adventure lives on in CartoonLand! Making room for new memories and heroes, we're thrilled to welcome back "Kikoriki" and introduce a fresh face to our channel, "Four Eyes!".

**"Kikoriki"**
The round, endearing characters of "Kikoriki" are set to make their triumphant return, bringing with them laughter, camaraderie, and heartwarming tales. This time, they'll be joined by their new friends from "Pincode", promising twice the fun and learning. Together, they'll fill the cherished slots and hearts that "Fast Forward" leaves behind, ensuring that the legacy of engaging entertainment and timeless values continues.

**"Four Eyes!"**
Stepping into the fold is "Four Eyes!", an innovative and enchanting series that follows the journey of Emma, an alien girl with extraordinary ambition. After flunking the 5th grade on her planet, she finds herself on Earth, determined to prove her worth. Emma's adventures through the complexities of school life, human interactions, and the pursuit of acceptance and success promise a blend of humor, heart, and the importance of embracing our differences. "Four Eyes!" will occupy the spare slots not taken by the double delight of "Kikoriki" shows, ensuring that the spirit of exploration and growth continues to flourish.

As we navigate these changes, we invite you to join us in welcoming "Kikoriki" back with open arms and to embrace Emma's journey in "Four Eyes!" with the curiosity and warmth that defines our incredible CartoonLand family. Let's continue to support and cherish the stories that make us laugh, think, and dream.

Thank you for being a monumental part of our community. Your passion and engagement are what make CartoonLand more than just a channel—it's a home for stories that unite us, inspire us, and remind us of the endless possibilities that lie within and beyond our screens.

Here’s to new beginnings, unforgettable adventures, and the magic of storytelling that binds us all.

Warmly,

**The CartoonLand Team**

---

*Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future. – John F. Kennedy*

**Title: A Glimmer of Hope: The Curious Case of One Show's Digital Persistence**

Dear CartoonLand Fans,

In the ever-changing world of television and digital media, transitions are a common theme. Shows come and go, leaving room for new stories to emerge and capture our hearts. Recently, CartoonLand underwent one of its seasonal transformations, resulting in a heartfelt farewell to several beloved shows. As we move forward, embracing the new adventures that await us, there's a small yet intriguing detail that hasn’t escaped the notice of our eagle-eyed viewers.

Many of you have observed that in the wake of these transitions, the online pages and digital footprints of most departing shows have vanished into the ether of the internet, like shooting stars fading into the cosmic ballet of the night sky. Social media profiles, official show pages, and even dedicated forums have been meticulously archived or removed, marking the definitive end to their chapter on CartoonLand.

However, amidst this digital cleanup, a lone survivor stands out. **The page for "Fast Forward"**, contrary to expectations, remains surprisingly active. No, your screens aren’t deceiving you. While its contemporaries have dimmed their beacons, the "Fast Forward" page continues to shine, a solitary lighthouse on the digital shore.

Now, why is this, you might wonder? In the vast universe of programming decisions and content management, such anomalies are rare and oftentimes deliberate. This lingering online presence has ignited a spark of speculation among fans and forums alike: **Could this be a hint of a possible return?**

While we at CartoonLand pride ourselves on being a vault of surprises, with our lips sealed tighter than the script of a season finale cliffhanger, we can neither confirm nor deny the swirling rumors. However, we encourage our dear fans to keep the fires of speculation burning bright. After all, it’s your passion and dedication that animate the heart and soul of CartoonLand.

Let this curious case serve as a reminder that in the world of animation, anything is possible. Stories may end, but they also evolve, and sometimes, just sometimes, they find their way back to us, reborn in ways we couldn’t have imagined.

So, to the detectives of digital minutiae and the hopeful hearts longing for the return of "Fast Forward", we see you. We hear you. And we're thrilled by the energy you bring to every twist and turn in our shared journey through the universe of CartoonLand programming.

Stay tuned, stay curious, and who knows? Perhaps your theories and wishes will manifest in ways that surprise even us. Until then, keep dreaming, keep watching, and keep believing in the magic of storytelling.

With animated enthusiasm,

**The CartoonLand Team**

---

Remember, every page turn is a portal to a new adventure, and every digital echo is a whisper of potential futures. In CartoonLand, the story never truly ends; it simply waits for the right moment to leap back into the light.

Title: Rediscovering "Quat'Zieux" (Four Eyes!) - A Hidden Gem in Cartoon History

In the ever-expanding universe of animated television, there are shows that capture the hearts of millions and become staples of their time, etched into the fabric of popular culture. Then, there are those unique, whimsical creations that, for one reason or another, slip through the cracks, only to be rediscovered years later as hidden gems. One such show that deserves a spotlight shone on its obscure brilliance is "Quat'Zieux," known to English-speaking audiences as "Four Eyes!"

"Quat'Zieux" premiered in the early 2000s, introducing viewers to the endearing and quirky tale of Emma, a young alien girl with a distinctive four eyes. The show broke ground not just with its imaginative premise but also through its heartwarming storytelling and universal themes. Emma's journey begins in an unusual manner - she's deported from her home planet to Earth as a consequence of flunking the 5th grade. This unusual setup serves as a perfect backdrop for a series of adventures and learning experiences that are both entertaining and enlightening.

The central theme of "Quat'Zieux" revolves around adaptation and understanding. Emma, being from another planet, struggles to fit in with her human peers. However, it's through these challenges that the show explores deeper themes of acceptance, friendship, and the importance of embracing one's uniqueness. Each episode, while filled with humorous antics and galactic misunderstandings, carries a message that resonates with audiences of all ages.

A key aspect that makes "Quat'Zieux" stand out is its animation style. The show's creators employed a vibrant color palette and character designs that were innovative for its time, perfectly encapsulating the alien yet oddly familiar world Emma had to navigate. This visual uniqueness, combined with the charming storytelling, makes it a feast for the senses and imagination.

Despite its many virtues, "Quat'Zieux" did not achieve widespread popularity during its initial run. There are several theories as to why this might be the case, ranging from the saturation of animated series at the time to the show's marketing. However, like many underappreciated works of art, it has found a new lease of life in the age of the internet. Fans old and new have come together to share their appreciation for this quirky slice of cartoon history, celebrating its creativity, humor, and the lessons it imparted.

In retrospect, "Quat'Zieux" can be seen as a precursor to many modern shows that blend humor, heart, and the fantastical in unique ways. It reminds us that sometimes the most impactful stories come from the most unexpected places. For anyone looking to explore the rich tapestry of animated television, revisiting "Quat'Zieux" (Four Eyes!) offers a delightful glimpse into a show that, despite its obscurity, shines with the enduring themes of friendship, acceptance, and the joy of discovering one's place in the world. 

In celebrating "Quat'Zieux," we not only pay tribute to a forgotten gem but also to the limitless potential of animation to bring to life stories that are whimsical, poignant, and eternally relevant. Let's hope that Emma's adventures on Earth continue to inspire and entertain new generations of viewers, proving that even the most unlikely of heroes can make a lasting impact.
It aired on CITV in the UK for a brief period (while it was still Horrid Henry, Pokemon and 4Kids TV imports)

Embarking on its journey into the hearts of UK audiences, "Quat'Zieux" (Four Eyes!) found a brief home on CITV, a channel renowned for its eclectic mix of programming, including popular hits like "Horrid Henry," "Pokemon," and various 4Kids TV imports. Its appearance on CITV during this era marked a unique moment in the network's history, showcasing its willingness to explore diverse and innovative storytelling avenues.

Despite competing in a landscape dominated by heavyweights and fan-favorite shows, "Quat'Zieux" managed to carve out its own niche, captivating a segment of the audience with its distinctive charm and the compelling narrative of Emma, the four-eyed alien girl navigating the complexities of life on Earth. This period was a vibrant time for children's television in the UK, with a variety of shows catering to different tastes and interests. Amidst this array of programming, "Quat'Zieux" stood out for its unique premise—a testament to CITV's dedication to offering varied content.

The show's stint on CITV, albeit brief, is a period remembered fondly by those who chanced upon it. "Quat'Zieux" benefitted from the channel's broad reach, allowing it to touch the lives of many young viewers across the UK.  Its presence amid shows like "Horrid Henry," which delved into the mischievous adventures of its titular character, and "Pokemon," a globally beloved franchise about the journey of becoming a Pokémon Master, highlighted the diversity in storytelling that CITV aimed to deliver. "Quat'Zieux" added to this tapestry with its interplanetary narrative, blending educational themes with entertainment — a hallmark of many memorable children's shows.

However, like many hidden gems, "Quat'Zieux" didn't maintain a permanent spot in the limelight. The reasons for its brief tenure on CITV could be manifold, ranging from the ever-evolving programming needs of the channel to the competitive landscape of children's television, which sees many shows vying for young viewers' attention. Yet, its impact during its airing was undeniable for those who became its fans. The show offered a different perspective, wrapped in the guise of an animated series, on themes like fitting in, the value of education, and the power of friendship.

In retrospect, the fleeting presence of "Quat'Zieux" on CITV's lineup highlights the transient nature of television programming, where shows come and go, some leaving a lasting imprint while others fade into obscurity. For aficionados of animation and UK television history, however, the brief airing of "Quat'Zieux" serves as a reminder of the diversity and richness of programming available to children in the early 2000s. It's a call to always be on the lookout for those unique, offbeat offerings that, despite not achieving mainstream success, enrich the viewing experience with their heartfelt stories and imaginative worlds.

As we continue to navigate the vast landscape of children's television, the story of "Quat'Zieux" on CITV encourages us to cherish and seek out those special shows that, even if only briefly, light up the screen with their creativity and message. In doing so, we pay homage to the myriad narratives that have shaped, and continue to shape, the imaginations of young viewers everywhere.

As of my last update in April 2023, there appears to have been a slight mix-up in the details provided about the show "Quat'Zieux" (or "Four Eyes!" in English). To the best of my knowledge, there is no existing cartoon with the specific plotline about an alien girl named Emma deported to Earth for failing 5th grade in the described context. It seems the initial description could have been confused with or inspired by elements from other animated series or perhaps an amalgamation of various shows' themes.

However, the concept imagined offers a fascinating springboard to discuss themes commonly explored in children's animated series, such as the experience of being an outsider, the challenges of adapting to a new environment, and the journey towards acceptance and understanding—both self and societal. Many animated shows delve into these themes, often portraying characters from other worlds or with unique attributes trying to fit into a society that's new or foreign to them.

For instance, shows like "My Life as a Teenage Robot" present a protagonist who is literally not human (a robot, in this case) but deals with many human issues such as identity, acceptance, and the longing to fit in. Similarly, "Lilo & Stitch: The Series" explores the concept of familial love, friendship, and acceptance through the adventures of a young Hawaiian girl and her alien 'dog,' showcasing how beings from different worlds can form unbreakable bonds.

Moreover, educational cartoons often incorporate extraterrestrial or fantastical characters to discuss and teach real-world issues and subjects in an engaging manner, making the imagined premise of "Quat'Zieux" not far removed from the thematic elements present in many beloved children's shows.

These series leverage the appeal of alien or otherworldly protagonists to widen the viewers' imaginations and foster empathy by presenting relatable challenges in fantastical wrappers. They teach valuable lessons about diversity, tolerance, and the importance of embracing differences, often leading to the realization that, deep down, we share many commonalities regardless of our backgrounds or origins.

While the specific plotline involving an alien girl named Emma might not correspond to a known show, the themes it suggests embody the heart and soul of children's animation. These stories encourage young audiences to look beyond the surface, promote inclusive values, and inspire a sense of wonder about the universe and the diverse beings that might inhabit it, fictional or otherwise.

The conversation around such an imaginative show—though seemingly fictional—highlights the power and impact of animation as a storytelling medium, capable of bridging worlds and bringing to life stories that entertain, educate, and inspire.
It's extremely obscure, In fact, I'd go as far as to say its the most obscure toon EVER, Even more so than Wubbzy or Will and Dewitt

The realm of animated television is vast, with thousands of shows having been produced and aired around the globe, catering to various tastes, cultures, and age groups. Among these, many have soared to become part of the mainstream consciousness, while others remain cherished by niche audiences or become collectors' items due to their rarity. Indeed, the charm of animation lies not only in its universal appeal but also in its ability to breed a rich variety of content, some of which flies under the radar to become the kind of obscure gems aficionados love to discover. Shows like "Wow! Wow! Wubbzy!" and "Will and Dewitt" themselves have fanbases and are remembered by those who grew up watching them, despite not having the widespread recognition of giants like "SpongeBob SquarePants" or "The Simpsons."

Given this context, the mention of "Quat'Zieux" (Four Eyes!) contributes to the tapestry of little-known animated series, even if, in this case, it appears to be a mix-up or misunderstanding. However, discussing it invites an interesting exploration into what makes a show "obscure" and how certain series achieve cult status or become a treasured piece of someone's childhood memories despite not achieving widespread fame.

Obscurity in animation can come from various factors:

1. **Limited Regional Release:** Some shows have a brief run in specific regions or countries and never see international distribution. This makes them obscure outside their original broadcast area but possibly well-loved within it.

2. **Short Run Time:** Series that are canceled early or designed as mini-series can easily fall into obscurity due to their brief presence on the air.

3. **Niche Audience:** Shows that target a very specific audience are less likely to break into the mainstream but can become highly valued within their target demographic.

4. **Lack of Accessibility:** If a show isn't available on popular streaming platforms or for purchase, it’s harder for new audiences to discover it, which can lead to its status as an obscure title.

5. **Changing Viewing Trends:** The way people consume content has evolved, with streaming platforms now dominating what was once the territory of cable and network television. Shows that aired in less digitally connected times without a transition to new formats may slip into obscurity.

Despite the obscurity, these shows can leave a lasting impact on their viewers, offering unique stories, perspectives, and artistry that resonate on a personal level. The discussions they spark, much like the one around "Quat'Zieux," not only shed light on the vast and varied landscape of animation but also underscore the medium's power to connect, entertain, and inspire, regardless of how many people ultimately see it.

In celebrating obscure animations, we're reminded that every creation has value, often holding a special place in someone's heart or offering a unique window into different cultures and storytelling traditions. Whether or not "Quat'Zieux" exists as described, its invocation enriches the conversation about animation's hidden treasures, encouraging exploration and appreciation of the lesser-known corners of the animated world.

Thread Title: CW4Kids Lineup Changing Back to Early 2007 Kids WB?! Anyone Else Seeing This?

AnimeFan93:

Hey everyone,

So, this Saturday morning, I turned on CW4Kids expecting the usual lineup, but to my surprise, the schedule was straight out of early 2007 Kids WB! I’m not sure if it’s some kind of glitch, a special event, or a permanent change, but it was a total blast from the past.

Here’s what the lineup looked like before, from 7am to 12pm:

7:00 AM - Yu-Gi-Oh! 5Ds
7:30 AM - Viva Pinata 
8:00 AM - GoGoRiki
8:30 AM - The Spectacular Spider Man
9:00 AM - Chaotic 
9:30 AM - Huntik: Secrets and Seekers
10:00 AM - Sonic X
10:30 AM - Kirby: Right Back At Ya
11:00 AM - Dinosaur King
11:30 AM - TMNT: Fast Forward

And here’s what aired today:

7:00 AM - Loonatics Unleashed
7:30 AM - Xiaolin Showdown
8:00 AM - Johnny Test
8:30 AM - Legion of Super Heroes
9:00 AM - The Batman
9:30 AM - Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!
10:00 AM - Tom and Jerry Tales
10:30 AM - Monster Allergy
11:00 AM - Spider Riders
11:30 AM - Magi-Nation

Has anyone else experienced this? Is it happening nationwide, or just on my local station? I checked the official CW4Kids website and their social media, but there’s no mention of reverting to the old Kids WB lineup. Wondering if it’s a technical glitch or maybe a surprise nostalgia event.

Would love to hear if this is happening elsewhere!

ToonLover105:

Wow, that’s crazy, AnimeFan93! I can’t believe it. Haven’t seen those shows on TV in years. I’m elsewhere in the country, but all we got was the regular CW4Kids schedule this morning. Sounds like a fun glitch or a really cool event. I hope it’s something they do more frequently if it’s intentional!

RetroFan88:

Nothing like that in my area, but man, what I wouldn’t give to see Legion of Super Heroes and The Batman air again. It sounds like you hit a jackpot, AnimeFan93! Maybe it’s a test run for a nostalgia block, or perhaps a one-off thing? Either way, super jealous here.

DigitalWatcher101:

I’m a bit of a skeptic here - could it be that your TV guide was just not updated or glitched out? Sometimes, my TV does weird things, and I swear I’m seeing content that isn’t supposed to be there. Although, the lineup you described does sound like an awesome Saturday morning.

NostalgiaNut45:

No way! They brought back Monster Allergy?! That’s one of those underrated shows I never thought I’d see on air again. I need to check my local listings and hope for a miracle here too. AnimeFan93, keep us posted if it happens again next weekend!

AnimeFan93:

Thanks for the responses, everyone! I thought I was losing it for a moment there. I’ll be sure to check again next Saturday and let you all know if the classic lineup airs once more or if it was just a one-time miracle. Fingers crossed it happens again – wouldn’t mind reliving those childhood Saturday mornings a bit longer!
Write a follow up update the next week

Thread Update: Did the CW4Kids Classic Lineup Air Again? Here's What Happened!

AnimeFan93:

Hey, everyone!

As promised, I’m back with an update about the CW4Kids/early 2007 Kids WB lineup situation. So, I got up bright and early again this past Saturday, eagerly awaiting to see if last week's flashback was a one-off event or something more. Sadly, it looks like it was just a temporary glitch in the matrix—this week reverted back to the usual CW4Kids schedule:

7:00 AM - Yu-Gi-Oh! 5Ds
7:30 AM - Viva Pinata
8:00 AM - GoGoRiki
8:30 AM - The Spectacular Spider-Man
9:00 AM - Chaotic
9:30 AM - Huntik: Secrets and Seekers
10:00 AM - Sonic X
10:30 AM - Kirby: Right Back At Ya
11:00 AM - Dinosaur King

I was really hoping that last week's lineup was a deliberate nostalgic event or perhaps a teaser for something bigger, but no such luck. This week, everything was back to normal with no sign of the classic Kids WB lineup. I did reach out to my local CW station and they mentioned a "technical scheduling error" last week, which led to the unexpected lineup. So, unfortunately, it doesn't look like a nostalgia block is in the works—at least not officially.

ToonLover105:

That’s a bummer, AnimeFan93! But hey, at least you got to experience that blast from the past, even if it was just for one week. Maybe the positive reaction to the glitch (at least from us nostalgic fans) might encourage them to consider a real throwback event in the future.

RetroFan88:

Total letdown, but thanks for keeping us in the loop, AnimeFan93. I guess it’s back to streaming services and DVDs to catch our old favorites. Still, fingers crossed that the powers-that-be see there’s interest and give us a dedicated nostalgia block one of these days.

DigitalWatcher101:

Mystery solved, then. Gotta love when technology throws us a curveball like that. At least it was a fun, albeit accidental, trip down memory lane for those who got to witness it!

NostalgiaNut45:

Thanks for updating us, AnimeFan93. A bit sad it was just a technical error, but what a cool error to have, right? Maybe we should start a petition or something for a classic Saturday morning block – I bet there’s more of us out there who’d love this to become a reality.

AnimeFan93:

Appreciate all the responses and empathy, folks! I'm glad I wasn't alone in feeling the excitement. Maybe if there's enough buzz, something good will come out of it. And NostalgiaNut45, I like the way you think—a petition could be interesting. Let's keep the hope alive and our fingers crossed. For now, though, it’s back to finding our beloved classics through other means. Catch you all around, and here’s to more pleasant surprises in the future!

Thread Update: Surprising Turn of Events - Classic KWB Lineup Returns, But Not Without Losses

AnimeFan93:

Hey, everyone!

Remember the unexpected return of the classic Kids WB lineup on CW4Kids a couple of weekends ago, followed by the disappointing revelation that it was just a "technical scheduling error"? Well, there's been a surprising turn of events that I think many of you will find interesting.

This past Saturday, I geared up for my usual weekend cartoon binge, half expecting the regular CW4Kids schedule after the previous letdown. To my total astonishment, the classic Kids WB lineup was BACK! Only this time, it appears intentional, as the local station ran teasers hyping the return of our beloved shows. Here's the kicker, though: amidst the excitement of seeing shows like "Legion of Super Heroes," "The Batman," and "Xiaolin Showdown" back on air, I realized that "Smeshariki/GoGoRiki" and "Sonic X" were notably missing from the lineup.

Instead, the lineup from 7am to 12pm was as follows:

7:00 AM - Loonatics Unleashed
7:30 AM - Xiaolin Showdown
8:00 AM - Johnny Test
8:30 AM - Legion of Super Heroes
9:00 AM - The Batman
9:30 AM - Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!
10:00 AM - Tom and Jerry Tales
10:30 AM - Monster Allergy
11:00 AM - Spider Riders
11:30 AM - Magi-Nation

While it's thrilling to have the classic KWB shows back, the absence of "Smeshariki/GoGoRiki" and "Sonic X" did not go unnoticed. It's a bittersweet change; while we celebrate the return of many childhood favorites, fans of "Sonic X" and the quirky world of "Smeshariki" are left wanting.

ToonLover105:

Wow, I never thought they'd actually bring the KWB lineup back for real! It’s amazing news, but missing "Sonic X" is a tough pill to swallow. That show was a huge part of my Saturday mornings. Maybe they’re planning to rotate some shows in and out?

RetroFan88:

Incredible! This has got to be one of the best surprises this year. Crossing my fingers they'll find a way to bring "Sonic X" back, though. It deserves a spot in that nostalgic lineup too.

DigitalWatcher101:

Guess the positive feedback they received (and maybe our confusion over the "technical glitch"?) prompted them to make the switch. It's awesome, but I have to agree about missing "GoGoRiki" and "Sonic X." Hopefully, those shows will pop up on the schedule at some point or maybe even on a streaming service.

NostalgiaNut45:

Honestly, I celebrate the return of the classic lineup, but "Sonic X" not being there is more disappointing than I thought it would be. Still, let's enjoy what we have and keep voicing our support for those missing titles!

AnimeFan93:

Absolutely, everyone. It's a mix of emotions, but overall, this return feels like a victory for nostalgia fans. Let's hope that with enough interest and support, we might see a more inclusive rotation that brings back "Sonic X" and "GoGoRiki." For now, Saturdays are once again a portal to childhood for many of us. Let's keep the conversation going and maybe, just maybe, our combined voices will bring about even more positive changes!
Write a follow up where they check the schedule for the next few weeks on their station, and the week later it appears permanent, (rip Pogoriki and Chikoriki)

Thread Update: Classic KWB Lineup Seems Permanent, But at a Cost

AnimeFan93:

Hello again, nostalgic warriors!

The past couple of weeks have been quite the rollercoaster for us fans of the classic Kids WB lineup on CW4Kids. Since my last update where I shared the exciting yet bittersweet return of our beloved KWB shows—minus “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” and “Sonic X”—I’ve been closely monitoring the station's schedule, hoping for signs of what’s to come.

Well, it appears I have news: the classic KWB lineup seems to be cemented as the new (or should I say, returned) normal for the foreseeable future. I've checked the schedule for the next few weeks, and it consistently features the same set of shows that replaced the more recent CW4Kids programming. Sadly, there's no indication that “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” or “Sonic X” will be making a comeback, marking what seems to be a permanent removal (RIP Pogoriki and Chikoriki).

Here’s the confirmed lineup for the next several weeks:

7:00 AM - Loonatics Unleashed
7:30 AM - Xiaolin Showdown
8:00 AM - Johnny Test
8:30 AM - Legion of Super Heroes
9:00 AM - The Batman
9:30 AM - Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!
10:00 AM - Tom and Jerry Tales
10:30 AM - Monster Allergy
11:00 AM - Spider Riders
11:30 AM - Magi-Nation

It’s a mixed bag of emotions. On one hand, the commitment to bringing back these classics is something many of us dreamed about but never truly believed would happen. On the other hand, the exclusion of “Sonic X” and “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” feels like a loss for fans who cherished those series as part of their childhood repertoire.

ToonLover105:

It’s official then? That’s incredible news for classic KWB fans! It does sting not seeing "Sonic X" in the lineup, though. Here’s to hoping they’ll still find a way to honor all parts of their legacy, including the shows we’re missing now.

RetroFan88:

Permanent, huh? I guess it’s time to celebrate the wins and mourn the losses. “Sonic X” and “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” will be missed, but seeing the rest of the KWB classics holding strong gives me hope. Maybe fan petitions or letters could sway them in the future?

DigitalWatcher101:

Permanent changes are always a bit of a double-edged sword, aren't they? Thrilled for the return of so many classics, but it’s a shame about the ones left behind. Does anyone know if there’s another place to catch “Sonic X” or “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” episodes?

NostalgiaNut45:

I’m over the moon that the KWB lineup is back for good, but definitely feeling a pinch for “Sonic X” and “Smeshariki.” They were such a big part of what made Saturday mornings special. Let’s not lose hope, though. Channels change, but fan demand can bring shows back from the vault!

AnimeFan93:

Your optimism and passion are what make this community amazing, everyone. While we enjoy the return of many KWB classics, let’s also keep the memory and love for “Sonic X” and “Smeshariki/GoGoRiki” alive in our discussions and fan efforts. Who knows what the future may bring if we continue to speak up about our favorites? Keep watching, keep hoping, and most importantly, keep sharing your thoughts and memories. Here’s to more nostalgic victories and possible comebacks!

conversation.content:
In late 2007, Kids’ WB, a children’s programming block that aired on The CW, offered a mix of animated series ranging from action to comedy. During this period, the lineup had just been refreshed with the introduction of “Will and Dewitt” among others. Although specific lineups could vary slightly by region and over time, a typical Saturday morning schedule for Kids’ WB around that period could have looked something like this:

Kids’ WB Late 2007 Saturday Morning Lineup:

1. 7:00 AM - “Will and Dewitt”: The show follows the adventures of a young boy named Will and his talking frog Dewitt. The show focuses on themes of friendship, problem-solving, and the power of imagination.

2. 7:30 AM - “Magi-Nation”: This series features the journey of a young boy, Tony Jones, transported to the magical land of the Moonlands where he embarks on a quest to defeat evil forces and discover his destiny.

3. 8:00 AM - “Tom and Jerry Tales”: A continuation of the classic cat and mouse chase, this version brings new adventures of Tom and Jerry, sticking closely to the original format but with updated stories and settings.

4. 8:30 AM - “Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!”: Focusing on Shaggy and Scooby-Doo, this series diverges from the traditional mystery-solving format to follow the duo as they inherit a fortune and combat villains with futuristic gadgets.

5. 9:00 AM - “Johnny Test”: This show centers on the adventures of a fearless 11-year-old boy, Johnny Test, his genetically engineered super dog Dukey, and his genius twin sisters who use him as a test subject for their experiments.

6. 9:30 AM - “Legion of Super Heroes”: Set in the 31st century, this series follows a young Superman as he’s recruited by a group of future heroes to battle evil throughout the universe.

7. 10:00 AM - “The Batman”: Focusing on a younger Bruce Wayne early in his career as Batman, the series showcases his confrontations with Gotham’s most infamous villains along with meeting future allies.

8. 10:30 AM - “Xiaolin Showdown”: This animated series features a group of young warriors training in martial arts and magic to protect mystical artifacts from evil forces.

9. 11:00 AM - “Monster Allergy”: This animated series revolves around a young boy, Zick, who has the ability to see and interact with monsters that others can’t see. Together with his friend Elena Potato, he navigates adventures in a world filled with mystical creatures, aiming to capture and domesticate them. The show blends action and comedy, focusing on themes of friendship and bravery.

10. 11:30 AM - “Skunk Fu!”: “Skunk Fu!” is a comedic action-adventure animated series that follows Skunk, a young and impetuous martial arts student under the tutelage of Panda. Together with an ensemble cast of animal warriors, they defend their valley from Dragon and his minions. The show emphasizes lessons about environmental protection, the importance of strategy over brute force, and the value of teamwork.

Alternative Programming Consideration:
Given the dynamic nature of television schedules and the necessity for networks to respond to audience preferences and regulatory requirements, it’s also possible that Kids’ WB might have included other educational or new animated series in this slot over time. Additionally, special programming such as holiday-themed episodes or mini-marathon events could temporarily alter the regular schedule.

Kids’ WB’s strategy, especially by late 2007, was undergoing adjustments to maintain viewership in the face of increasing competition from cable networks and evolving digital entertainment platforms. The inclusion of fresh and diverse content was part of their broader aim to both entertain and educate their young audience in line with emerging trends and preferences.
Write the final lineup from March 2008 with Spectacular Spider-Man and World of Quest (This would lead us into CW4Kids, with the first schedule update coming on June 21)

In March 2008, Kids' WB revised its lineup to introduce new shows, including "The Spectacular Spider-Man" and "World of Quest." This change aimed to rejuvenate the programming block and keep pace with audience expectations before the transition to CW4Kids in June of the same year. Here's what the final Kids' WB Saturday morning lineup looked like in March 2008:

Kids' WB March 2008 Saturday Morning Lineup:

1. 7:00 AM - **"Will and Dewitt"**: Continuing from the late 2007 lineup, "Will and Dewitt" stayed in its original time slot, offering the adventures of Will and his talking frog friend Dewitt, focusing on friendship and imagination.

2. 7:30 AM - **"Magi-Nation"**: Also unchanged, "Magi-Nation" remained in its slot, continuing the story of Tony Jones in the Moonlands.

3. 8:00 AM - **"Tom and Jerry Tales"**: This iteration of the classic cat-and-mouse chase retained its place in the programming block, offering updated adventures of Tom and Jerry.

4. 8:30 AM - **"The Spectacular Spider-Man"**: As one of the new additions, this series followed Peter Parker in his early years as Spider-Man, dealing with the familiar dual life struggles and iconic villains.

5. 9:00 AM - **"Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!"**: Moving from its earlier slot, this series featured Shaggy and Scooby-Doo using high-tech gadgets to solve mysteries, slightly deviating from their traditional format.

6. 9:30 AM - **"Johnny Test"**: This show retained its slot, showcasing the adventures and experiments of Johnny Test, Dukey, and his genius twin sisters.

7. 10:00 AM - **"Legion of Super Heroes"**: Continuing to feature a young Superman teaming up with future heroes, it stayed in its morning position.

8. 10:30 AM - **"The Batman"**: The series kept its time slot, depicting a younger Batman early in his crime-fighting career in Gotham.

9. 11:00 AM - **"World of Quest"**: Another new addition, this series introduced viewers to Prince Nestor and his unlikely protector, Quest, as they embark on a journey to save Nestor’s parents and their kingdom.

10. 11:30 AM - **"Skunk Fu!"**: Remaining in the lineup, "Skunk Fu!" continued to teach valuable lessons through the adventures of Skunk and his friends in their quest to protect their valley.

This was the last major refresh of Kids' WB's programming before it transitioned to The CW4Kids. The change to include shows like "The Spectacular Spider-Man" and "World of Quest" was part of an effort to adapt to changing tastes and maintain a strong audience base in a competitive children's programming landscape, bridging familiar content with new additions to intrigue and engage viewers.
Write the lineup which takes effect from June 21, incorporating TMNT: FF, Chaotic and Yu-Gi-Oh GX

With the transition from Kids' WB to The CW4Kids which took effect on June 21, 2008, the programming lineup underwent significant changes to include an array of new and continuing series aimed at broadening its viewer base. This refresh was part of a strategy to energize the Saturday morning cartoon block with an exciting mix of action-packed and adventure-laden shows. Here's what the lineup looked like following the transition on June 21, integrating shows like "TMNT: Fast Forward" (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward), "Chaotic," and "Yu-Gi-Oh! GX":

The CW4Kids June 21, 2008, Saturday Morning Lineup:

1. **7:00 AM - "Will and Dewitt"**: Continuing from Kids' WB, the show features the adventures of a young boy named Will and his talking frog, Dewitt.

2. **7:30 AM - "The Spectacular Spider-Man"**: Following Peter Parker in his earlier days as Spider-Man, encapsulating his battles with iconic villains and personal struggles.

3. **8:00 AM - "Tom and Jerry Tales"**: This update on the classic cat and mouse rivalry brings new life to their comedic chases with fresh episodes.

4. **8:30 AM - "Chaotic"**: A significant addition to the lineup, "Chaotic" mixes animated sequences with live-action as it tells the story of a group of teenagers who play a collectible card game that transports them to a parallel universe.

5. **9:00 AM - "TMNT: Fast Forward" (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward)**: Taking the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to the future, this series focuses on new adventures in a cyber-centric world, offering a fresh take on the beloved characters.

6. **9:30 AM - "Yu-Gi-Oh! GX"**: Set in a future where Duel Monsters is a competitive sport played at the Duel Academy, this spin-off follows a young duelist, Jaden Yuki, as he aims to become the next King of Games.

7. **10:00 AM - "Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!"**: In this series, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo inherit riches and use their new resources to fight evil with futuristic gadgets.

8. **10:30 AM - "The Batman"**: Continues to depict a younger Bruce Wayne in his early days as Batman, facing off against Gotham’s notorious criminals.

9. **11:00 AM - "Monster Allergy"**: Following the adventures of Zick, a young boy who can see monsters, and his friend Elena Potato as they navigate through a world filled with supernatural beings.

10. **11:30 AM - "Johnny Test"**: Concluding the morning, this show follows the adventures and experiments involving Johnny Test, his talking dog Dukey, and his genius twin sisters.

This revitalized lineup under The CW4Kids banner aimed to blend continuing popular series with new additions to offer a dynamic range of programming that catered to the diverse interests of its young audience. With a mix of action, comedy, and fantasy, the block sought to maintain its competitiveness in the crowded landscape of children's entertainment by appealing to both loyal viewers and attracting new ones.
Write a forum convo in early June announcing Magi-Nation, Skunk Fu and World of Quest's removal, the 3 4Kids shows arriving and the one returning show

**Thread Title:** Major Changes Coming to The CW4Kids Lineup This June! 🚀📺

**Post by ToonFan88** on June 3, 2008, at 07:45 PM

Hey everyone!

Big news for all of us following The CW4Kids Saturday mornings! I've just caught wind of some major shake-ups in the lineup starting June 21st, and I thought I'd share the scoop here. It seems we're saying goodbye to a few shows and welcoming some new (and returning) faces to our weekend cartoon binge!

**Leaving Us:**

- **Magi-Nation**: It's been a good run with Tony Jones and his adventures in the Moonlands. I'm definitely going to miss this one.
- **Skunk Fu!**: The environmental kung-fu adventures have been a blast. Sad to see Skunk and Panda go.
- **World of Quest**: This one had a short run, but Prince Nestor and Quest's journey had its charm.

**Coming to The CW4Kids:**

- **Chaotic**: Mixing animation with some live-action, this card game turned adventure is making its way into our lineup. I've heard good things about it, and it seems to have a solid fan base.
- **TMNT: Fast Forward (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward)**: Our favorite turtles are back, and this time, they're tackling the future! TMNT has always been a hit, so it's exciting to see them return with a new twist.
- **Yu-Gi-Oh! GX**: For all the Duel Monsters aficionados out there, get ready for some intense dueling action at the Duel Academy!

**Returning:**

And for fans of spell-slinging and mythical beasts, rejoice because **"Yu-Gi-Oh! GX"** is not exactly new, but it's making a return to our Saturday mornings. Jaden Yuki's journey to become the next King of Games continues!

It's always bittersweet to see some shows leave, but the new additions are looking promising. What do you guys think? Which shows are you going to miss, and which ones are you excited about? Let's get a discussion going!

---

**Reply by CartoonCraze1990** on June 3, 2008, at 08:10 PM

Super bummed about **Magi-Nation** and **Skunk Fu!** 😢 But, **TMNT: Fast Forward** sounds awesome! Can’t wait to see what the future holds for the turtles.

---

**Reply by DuelMaster_K** on June 3, 2008, at 08:45 PM

**Yu-Gi-Oh! GX** returning is the best news I’ve heard all day! Time to see Jaden in action again. Also looking forward to what **Chaotic** brings to the table. Always up for a new adventure!

---

**Reply by AnimatedAdventurer** on June 3, 2008, at 09:30 PM

Sad to see **World of Quest** go so soon, was really growing fond of it. But the future looks interesting with these new shows. Especially curious about **Chaotic** and seeing the TMNT in a whole new setting!

---

**Reply by ToonFan88** on June 4, 2008, at 10:00 AM

Great to see everyone’s thoughts! It’s definitely a mix of emotions with these changes, but I’m optimistic. The CW4Kids seems to be putting a lot of faith in these new additions. Here’s to hoping they live up to our expectations! 🥂📺 Keep the thoughts coming, everyone!

---

**Thread Continues Below...**
Write a follow up saying MA is returning effective June 21, and the image of Nestor has been replaced by that show's protagonist

**Thread Title:** Exciting Update: MA Returns to The CW4Kids Lineup This June! 🔮✨

**Post by ToonFan88** on June 10, 2008, at 11:30 AM

Hello again, fellow cartoon enthusiasts!

I've got a thrilling update to the major lineup changes we discussed last week. After hearing our discussions and probably feeling the love for **Magi-Nation (MA)**, The CW4Kids has decided to bring back the magical adventures of Tony Jones and his quests in the Moonlands! That's right, effective June 21st, Magi-Nation is returning to our Saturday mornings. 🎉

And for those of you who noticed the promotional images - yes, the image of Nestor from **World of Quest** has been replaced by Tony's determined face, signaling a strong comeback for the series. This is a rare instance of fan voices making a real impact on programming decisions, and it's something to be proud of!

**Updated Lineup (Revised):**

With the return of MA, here’s how the new schedule shapes now:

- 7:00 AM - "Will and Dewitt"
- 7:30 AM - "The Spectacular Spider-Man"
- 8:00 AM - "Tom and Jerry Tales"
- 8:30 AM - "Chaotic"
- 9:00 AM - "TMNT: Fast Forward" (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward)
- 9:30 AM - **"Magi-Nation"** (Yes, it’s back!)
- 10:00 AM - "Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!"
- 10:30 AM - "The Batman"
- 11:00 AM - "Monster Allergy"
- 11:30 AM - "Johnny Test"

**Discussion:**

What do you think about this update? I'm personally over the moon about MA's return – it’s a victory for all of us who cherish this imaginative series. It’s also an interesting move to see how quickly The CW4Kids responded to the reactions from the audience.

How do you feel about these last-minute changes? Are there other shows you think deserve a comeback or maybe some you’d like to see introduced in the future? Let's keep the conversation going!

---

**Reply by MagicMoonFan** on June 10, 2008, at 12:15 PM

This is AMAZING news!! 🌙✨ Magi-Nation has been one of my favorites, and knowing it's coming back has made my day. This shows that our voices really do matter. So excited for June 21st!

---

**Reply by ToonBingeWatcher** on June 10, 2008, at 1:00 PM

Honestly, I didn't expect them to bring back any shows they decided to drop. Goes to show The CW4Kids is really watching and listening. This change has seriously hyped me up for what’s to come!

---

**Reply by AnimatedAdventurer** on June 10, 2008, at 1:45 PM

I was bummed when I read about **World of Quest** leaving, but this update softens the blow. I’m thrilled about **Magi-Nation**; it’s a hidden gem. Here’s hoping more surprises like this come our way!

---

**Reply by DuelMaster_K** on June 10, 2008, at 2:30 PM

Mixed feelings here, was looking forward to the new lineup, but I get the love for MA. Curious to see how it’ll fit back into the mix with the new shows coming in. Also, here's hoping that our feedback keeps being a powerful tool for change!

---

**Reply by ToonFan88** on June 11, 2008, at 09:00 AM

Loving these reactions and the positivity! It's a win for the community, and MA's return is a testament to how passionate we all are about our favorite shows. Keep the comments coming, and let's continue to support our beloved toons! 📺💖

---
